cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border between Sea Rim State Park, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Watch Mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS including area lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; Storm Surge Warning Freeport, TX to Mouth of Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from Freeport, TX eastward to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, including the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of hurricane-force winds (64-kt probability ~65%) with sustained winds potentially exceeding 100 mph near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 10–15 ft possible in Sabine Lake and the Port Arthur area, with water penetration well inland.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inch totals could produce flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possibility of tornadoes in rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
